The real advantage of a multi-sig is the decentralization aspect, we can set it up on gnosis so everyone in the committee is in there but we can set up a rule so we would need x persons to sign a transaction, for example: We are 5 in the gnosis safe but we set up a rule so it would only need 2 signs for a transaction to fulfill, or we can set that everyone in the safe has to sign it. I believe this is the main decision we have to make - I believe 2 signatures is enough as we are not many, but we can discuss

We then have to manually assign the amount that everyone will get related to the "grain" or TCRED accumulated in sourcecred - After that we make one transaction using https://disperse.app/ . I need to check if this works properly with a gnosis safe

> so this is the bot we use for pollen-related tasks https://github.com/1Hive/pollen-bot it uses a MongoDB to store user-saved information like social accounts and wallet addresses. If you just want it to store user information I think just forking and redeploying would work. 
> 
> If you wanted the fully automated process and cred information for users, you'd need to also fork our pollen-cred-fetcher script https://github.com/1Hive/pollen-cred-fetcher which saves cred and identities basic information from the ledger and the credGraph into MongoDB every time the SourceCred instance is updated or recalculated. You'd also need the pollen-onboarding script https://github.com/1Hive/pollen-onboarding which reads user information from the DB and updates the ledger, merging ids, activating them and adding wallet addresses to them every time it's executed.
> 
> Seems kind of overwhelming, but I think it's easy to set up. Feel free to ping me if you need help with that 🙂

messages.content: when this week would be good for you?

@liviade suggested we meet up and discuss how we make the Reward System proposal become a reality in the near- to midterm! We need a working Reward System in place as close in time as possible to the commons upgrade. Do we integrate SourceCred with the praise system, integrate the praise system with SourceCred, build something from scratch or make do with spreadsheets, gaff tape and a better documented process?

Ideally we would like to create something that solves our needs - better analytics and transparency among other things - and is "product" enough to be reused by other communities without too much of an effort.

Let's look at the process from praise to payment and try to identify all moving parts, who does what, etc. 

See Miro – Reward System Process: https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_lyTkWjY=/

This is a separate track from the more long term work done by the Governauts Reward System Research group. The findings from that work might be implemented in future versions of the process.

📆 Thursday 16 September, 16:00 CET

(Invite is in the TEC calendar as well, please invite anyone I didn't have the email address to)

Could praise be imported into SourceCred? I read up on how the SourceCred contributor graph works and made an attempt graphing some real praise data from earlier this year. 

These are my first thoughts:
- In In order to create a qualitative praise graph we would have to create separate nodes for "the praise" and for "the contribution". From the viewpoint of SourceCred the act of praising is also a contribution that could accumulate cred.
- We would have to identify all praise that references the same contribution. Otherwise the quality of the graph becomes much lower.

@hz, would this be a workable graph structure? I didn't include the weights but I imagine they would be manually estimated in the quant process and set on the edges connecting praise and contribution?
yes this looks like something that would work
Here is the image again:

If we choose to go that route with praise, perhaps this simple addition would allow us to do some automation and auto suggestions in the quantification process. And improve the quality of the graph.

– Adding an url reference to the praise where applicable, like so: `!praise @someone for sharing their research paper on token economics, https://xxx/zzz.pdf`
that sounds like plausible data to have in a node

The alternative to merging "similar" praise into one contribution is.. not doing it. @hz , would SC still be able to do a good job with a graph like this? SC seeing it as every praise as one contribution my hunch says would lead to weird and skewed results.
Praise always runs the risk of becoming a popularity contest, where 3 praise for one contribution gives you 3 times more cred/grain/IH than 1 praise for the same contribution.
Maybe this situation has been handled manually up to this point during praise quantification. I don't know yet but will find out, @liviade do you know?
I think this would be the way to go there might be a smart script that might detect the duplication or something that's done before the api results are fetched but yeah duplication is a problem

yeah this is a tricky scenario we don't have a solution for yet. In the beginning Griff and I would delete double praises, but that got really hard when we started scaling. We could try to educate quantifiers about this

One suggestion @🐙 octopus gave was to remove names from the quant process so quantifiers would become less biased - this is great, but if we go ahead with this idea what I mentioned above couldn't be solved just culturally

That's a good point; my thought would be to replace "their leadership" with something like "consistently hosting the X sessions and being available for questions afterwards". In my view, praise would be best if mapped to specific actions that are valued somewhat independent of performance?
If we say "her leadership of X" rather than just "her leadership", now we can assess the impact of X rather than how we feel about the person.

😆 Had a good talk with @hz today and gained some more insight into SourceCred plugins etc. Some takeaways:
- Building a plugin does not seem too difficult using the ExternalPlugin tools
- SourceCred already does something like 85% similar to praise using the included Discord bot and one channel configured for the purpose - *props* they call it. No manual quant though, number of reactions determine praise/props weight.
- SC also is planning or at least have been planning to build a separate tool called *The Creditor* with the purpose of tracking contributions outside of what can be more easily measured - "care work", "planning that conference", etc.

I'll check and find out how far they have come with the Creditor.

I have this idea for what happens with the data after being exported from praise and sourcecred. Not being a python/Jupyter wizard myself I'm asking you all to see if this is possible andor a good idea.

The general idea is to manage the "second half" of the rewards system process all in one Jupyter notebook. That means:
1. Bring the quantified praise data and SC data into the notebook as CSV
2. Make manual adjustments with comments (there seems to be a plugin allowing editing of CSV data)
3. Calculate the token rewards in a nice looking sheet with explanations, formulas and visualisations. This is where the TEC distribution algorithm lives.
4. Additional analysis and statistics on separate sheet along with a short quantification text report by the Rewards DAO Committee.

This whole package of notebook, data and edits would live on github and made accessible through https://mybinder.org/. 
And important: each new quantification period a copy of the notebook is made and put in a fresh folder on the repository, allowing you to move back in time and check on older quantifications.

messages.content: I outlined in the buy-in proposal draft that the reward system would seek funding for the first 6 months of rewards, I took a ball park number of 5-7.5k wxDAI distributed bi-weekly, giving us a range of 60k-90k wxDAI
in relative terms that is 24-36% of the buy-in amount we will be proposing
interesting, thanks for sharing! So if the base of grain redemption gets to $4k a month it means people are getting a decent income just with sourcecred.
I wonder if grain becomes a token, if we would still be able to distribute in TEC or if it would mean distros only happening in grain

in the last quantified period we had 726.167 IH
If we just double this to consider an approximate 2 week period we have 1,452.334 IH 
Dividing 7.5k to this total IH we would have 5.16 wxDAI per IH.
We are gonna be mixing IH with cred now, but we can balance them to bring a similar result of "worked hours"
5wxDAI is way below what we thought it was ideal - I wonder how we can bring it up in a sustainable way
sorry I'm not sure how long the quantification periods are, its one week then?
I think this was just one week because it was the last one, but usually it was two

🤔  so even if we double this amount to ~10 wxDAI, which still isn't great we end up with 15k per period... then for the 6 month period (12 quants) we arrive at 180k

that's 72% of the buy-in request for TEC and 11.4% of hatch funds

I believe strongly that for the initial period  of 6 months we should be conservative with the funds we allocate to the rewards system since there will be lots of learning and adjustments we'll need to make.. it would be a shame to misappropriate considerable amounts of hatch funds resulting from this "pilot" period
it would also be a different story if we raised 8 million from the hatch but unfortunately that wasn't the case
I agree if it's framed that way - of an experiment that will be readjusted as our economy gets stronger
and we'll have the proposals of the working groups running too, so there will be a lot to learn and balance out for sure
yes, the reward system will be one part of a vast array of expenditures

one further afterthought is that since we can acquire 6 months worth of TEC upfront we will benefit from any price increases of the token. We'll be holding a fix amount of TEC, but rewards are denominated in wxDAI, yet disbursed in TEC. 

so if at launch we have 90k wxDAI worth of TEC in the rewards system and the value of TEC doubles we'll have effectively 180k wxDAI worth of Rewards to use.
Why wouldn't you just make grain tech instead? It can be any token.

It's up to 8k and yes some people are making decent money on it some people due to insecurities are not engaging with the product in a way that rewards them properly. There are phycological bars to accessibility.  I've been waving flags about the architectural design flaws here for a while.

Hi everyone, moving forward with the committee, I would like to nominate a few people for us to get this settled.** If you are being nominated please react with a thumbs up if you want to participate, and a thumbs down if you don't. **

Being part of the committee is going to be a paid role and this are the responsibilities involved with it: 
- Manage funds from the initial buy-in proposal directed to the reward system. 
- Once the initial buy in funds are over; committee members will submit proposals to the DAO requesting funds. 
- Once funds are collected they will send wxDAI to the bonding curve and transfer the resulting TEC tokens to the Reward DAO
- Set up Sourcecred parameters 
- Coordinate with comms to recruit quantifiers and add them to the dashboard
- Create proposals in the Reward DAO with the data from the dashboard to distribute funds to contributors 
- Post an analysis report that will come pretty much ready from the dashboard. 

It's a substantial amount of work, so I suggest we have 7 people involved, who will be the only ones with voting power in the Rewards DAO
I suggest @mateodaza , @kristofer , @divine_comedian , @chuygarcia.eth , @Vyvy-vi , @ALOYSIOUS , @Nuggan , @liviade , @aka_roro @ygg_anderson

SourceCred requires community members to react to the posted messages for the grain calculation, right? We wanted to avoid that for meeting tracking. See attached pictures from SC Discord. is gratitude better than praise? Are "rewards" better than gratitude? I think not. How do they differ?

So, consider this work from Dr. Betty Martin. If we're talking about "rewards", we're on the left top part of this- we're taking an "action to benefit others". At least, we think this is benefitting others. However, reducing all service previously rendered to a flatland reward we eliminate a LOT of potential ways in which I might need to be rewarded.

I THINK that what we're trying to do is to make sure no one goes into do-gooder/martyr territory but on the other hand we cannot make someone accept something malformed for them any more than we want them to be in the freeloader/assumed privilege mode
I think our reward systems need a more trauma-informed approach than what I'm seeing typically shown. I can provide details about what I mean, if you want to know
Interestingly, if you look at this graphic about trauma-informed principles, you can see a LOT of alignment of motivation:
Since, almost all rewards are going to incentivize people, we should be able to grasp some of these principles
https://nationalfund.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/A-Trauma-Informed-Approach-to-Workforce.pdf
https://business.kaiserpermanente.org/insights/covid-19/trauma-informed-workplace

messages.content: I think we should consider such perspectives when creating our rewards system

The point here is not to create technical debt on TOP of cultural debt. We are inside the "cultural build" here, so we must consider that if we forget something technical created on top of a cultural assumption, a lack of care, or just through unintentional ignorance, then we might have to refactor tech to deal what we forgot to address. Both @Juankbell and myself have, despite looking at the Gravity work for some time, realized that we have cultural debt of our own, and broken or ignorant or denialist methods for dealing with things.  "Technical debt (also known as tech debt or code debt) describes what results when development teams take actions to expedite the delivery of a piece of functionality or a project which later needs to be refactored. In other words, it’s the result of prioritizing speedy delivery over perfect code."

So then we'll have to assume any review process of quants takes place before the vote is created since it is a very short duration. Things like Quorum and Support required are modifiable within an Aragon DAO (via a vote) but the vote duration sadly is not.

1. Reward data from Praise and SourceCred is merged in the Analysis/Distribution dashboard.

Going through the steps of an "ideal quant" in the analysis group we noticed that the way it is planned now, there are two groups of people involved in the process who have the chance to do direct modifications to the data: First the quants when they get together to review after the async phase, and then again the reward board when it reviews the proposal made by the quants.

Are we sure we want to keep it that way? While discussing, we thought that maybe it could be a good idea if the reward board only has the power to ratify the received quantification, or send it back to re-quantify if they find issues. It would add a level of transparency and "separation of powers" to the system.
It somehow defeats the point of the whole process of random/anonymous praise if at the end we have a stable group of people with direct access to modify the data...
(even if these modifications get recorded publicly!)
How does the community feel about this? Maybe we could take some time in the call tomorrow to discuss it?
thanks!!

messages.content:
hey @kristofer  I had some questions from the reward system dashboard you demo'd yesterday - 

What's the point in being able to name a quantification period? Shouldn't the title be the Quantification Period Dates - what's the point of calling it something other than that? 

How exactly does marking duplicate praise work? how does it work if we identify multiple (3+) instances of duplicate praise?

Period naming, similar to ZenHub/GitHub sprints. There is no reason not to allow for a name. Some community calls a period "June 2021", another wants to sync with sprint schedule and call it "Praise period #13".

Duplicate praise counts as 0 when avg score is calculated, simple as that. It works even if you and me as quantifiers mark different combinations of a group of praise as duplicates. Does that make sense? 🙂

Okay so if I'm a quantifier and I wanted to make a mess of things what happens when this happens: 

Praise 1, 2 ,3 are duplicate 

Quantify Praise 1  - > give weight of 32
Mark Praise 2 -> duplicate of Praise 1 
Mark Praise 3 -> duplicate of Praise 2
Mark Praise 1 -> duplicate of Praise 2

Would this be possible? would it throw an error?

Def would throw an error as that would create an endless duplication loop, a duplication vortex / black hole, which is not allowed. Thanks for highlighting this, we haven't exactly mapped out those rules yet. I imagine there are a number of edge cases and not really edge cases.

📣 📣 📣 📣
Oyez, Oyez! A praise dev announcement!
📣 📣 📣 📣

The Praise backend will make a pivot and move to new platform. The frontend will remain the same. We will start over with the backend development using the following tech stack: Node/Express/TypeScript/MongoDB

The reasons are many:
    - Working with Java and Spring has made the project dependent on one person. That is not a good situation. We __could__ find other Java developers but that takes time and we also have a community of developers alredy in the TEC, CS and General Magic. All those devs mostly prefer and know JS/TS/Python/Solidity.

    - I would like Praise to become as decentralised as possible in future versions. Making the switch from SQL to storing JSON docs in MongoDB will make that much easier. Many decentralised solutions - IPFS/Ceramic/Textile etc - offer the ability to store JSON documents but don't support anything looking like a relational database.

    - Building the backend and frontend using the same language will allow us to reuse code between layers - interfaces etc. 

    - The final distribution can be made simpler and smaller with less dependencies and require less knowledge from a community that would like to use Praise.

I wish I would have known and seen all this before we started but I didn't. That would have saved us a lot of time and effort. This is a realisation that has built up gradually and now seems like the right time to make a decision.

@Nebs will be laying down the foundation for the new backend in the coming days. Then we will have some work to do catching up with the roadmap on the new platform. I expect us to be able to move forward quite quickly, the work that has been put into the Java backend has definitely not been in vain, we will be taking all insights to the new platform - data model, business logic/rules, etc.

Will this affect the delivery date for the MVP version we need to do the trial quant? I don't know yet but hope to have a better sense of that within a week.

I hate to say it but ...

messages.content:
Soo, the new config for the sourcecred instance is up! These are the main changes
- TCRED is now called GRAIN so it's less confusing 
- We are using the new params, the ones chosen on the calls (you can see them in the picture)
- For the first distribution we have to delete manually the old grain and set the MaxSimultaneousDistributions variable to the number of weeks from July 25th until date

Great! What we would like to achieve is that we make a first grain distribution for the date July 25. And then one distribution every week from then until now. Another way to put it: Distributions are generated on Sundays with July 25 being the first.

Is this possible?
Let's sync up with metadreamer to learn status of metacred.
@METADREAMER 🐙
Hi Liviade 👋  Nice to be here.  How do you register for Praise and Sourcecred?  From my experience, I get praise by being in discord and sourcecred by being on github.
@kristofer ☝️ do you know?

Hey @Adam Stallard, sorry was afk during the weekend. Yeah, praise works on Discord and Telegram. And our SC instance has been configured to track contributions on Discourse and GitHub. 

To activate for Praise: Interact with the praise bot  `/praise-activate` (not launched yet), get redirected to the praise dashboard web where you sign a message using MetaMask. Discord and ETH linked.

To activate for SC: Interact with the Discord pollen bot developed by 1hive. Link your eth that way (unsecure/not signed link) and post proofs to Discourse/GitHub to link those accounts to your Identity.

So, no interaction between SC and Praise when it comes to Identities and proofs. 

Long term dream would be a centralised decentralised Identity management solution both SC and Praise can tap into. Perhaps running on Ceramic 🙂

In the short term I think we would be super happy to achieve something like this:

- Praise and SC exports data 
- We merge that data and calculate rewards
- We end up with a list of eth addresses and amounts
- Run that list through BrightId
- Only distribute TEC tokens to BrightId verified users on that list
- Mint a separate reputation token to those users as well
- Use that rep token for quadratic voting

@liviade @Griff (💜,💜) would that cover our need in the short term?
yes, that's exactly the idea!
@liviade was telling me that we could gate the registration for SC and praise using BrightID.
What happens if someone gives you praise or SC points (pollen in 1hive) and you're not activated?

Doesn't it make sense to move this step further down; i.e. only do the calculation on addresses that are BrightID verified--or are SC points and praise used for something else beside TEC tokens and the reputation token?

> - We merge that data and calculate rewards
> - We end up with a list of eth addresses and amounts

I thought we could do that for new users, but for everyone else we would still have to go through the process Kristofer described 
@Vyvy-vi is this something feasible to integrate with the onboarding bots?
I think it would still be good to have that data for analysis purposes, and maybe folks could "redeem" their score once they are activated. But i don't know how that looks technically

For SourceCred: Adding the ability to verify BrightId using the onboarding bot is in theory doable. It is not super easy though and it is  unclear what the verification would be used for. If we want cred and grain to be calculated only for verified users that would require a significant change to the core SC codebase. 

For Praise: We want it to be possible to praise anyone, even people outside of the community. So, verifying praise receivers is not an option. Verifying the senders could be done. But then again, the purpose needs to be clear. If we just want to mint the TEC REP token for voting, the method I proposed will work well and be fairly simple.

Anyone can be praised. Praise is tied to the discord username pimarily.

SourceCred tracks all contributions by all users and generate cred scores for all those users independent of any verifications, connected eth addresses etc.

The end result is the same in this case. The downside with filtering out verified users before calculating rewards is that if a user later verifies, information about retrospective rewards is not easily accessible.

This is process we need to figure out anyway. Many people will not have connected their eth addresses on first payout. Same thing. If they later activate or verify with brightid, how do we make sure they get all retrospective rewards payments on next payout?
Oh right.  There are bunch of existing users.  Should we just whitelist all existing users, or should we have them go through BrightID verification?
Ok got it!  Yes that data can be used to see how many people self-activate compared to how many go through BrightID verification.

>  verify BrightId using the onboarding bot is in theory doable. It is not super easy though
I mentioned it as potentially the easiest path.  Discord bots understand roles, and BrightID unique bot gives out the "verified" role.  It's really easy to add to a server.  Hundreds of servers are using it.  https://github.com/ShenaniganDApp/brightid-discord-bot

embeds.title: GitHub - ShenaniganDApp/brightid-discord-bot
embeds.description: Contribute to ShenaniganDApp/brightid-discord-bot development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content:
What I might be hearing is that we might want to gate with BrightID the voting with TEC REP tokens instead.  (Will those tokens be used for voting?)

> If we just want to mint the TEC REP token for voting

Where do they get used for voting? Is it a snapshot strategy?
afaik it's for quadratic voting
How is the quadratic voting implemented.  I know there's a snapshot strategy for that.
i believe it's snapshot but i'm not sure, kinda newbie around the TEC

yeah, it's on snapshot. The reason why I don't think it's a good idea to add the gate to snapshot versus the reward system is because people have an incentive to verify with BrightID if their rewards depend on it. But no one likes to vote already, so adding an extra step there seems counter intuitive
also because we want the rep to be tied with the rewards score, which I think gives the message that if you are receiving both TEC and rep tokens is because you can engage in governance
I also hear you saying that you want to collect data about who is collecting praise / SC , and how many of them are also BrightID verified.  So where is the ideal integration point?

Is this the best way?

> - We end up with a list of eth addresses and amounts
> - Run that list through BrightId
> - Only distribute TEC tokens to BrightId verified users on that list
that's the challenge we are trying to solve. @kristofer is suggesting in between quantification and distribution

If so we can create (or modify) a special frontend that allows users to register an eth address of their choosing with the TEC app in BrightID.  This is done anonymously; no one--not even BrightID nodes see the link between Eth address and BrightID, but it then allows us to get a yes/no answer about whether an eth address used for TEC has BrightID verification.

yeah seems like it -- I think it would be nice to have them integrated with the bots that get your ETH address for both SC and Praise. But not in a way that limits people's activity with praise and SC
this sounds great

Basically

> - Only distribute TEC tokens to BrightId verified users on that list

You would need to go to the web page to do this extra step in order to receive TEC tokens.
Just to make sure: there is no registration step that currently happens right here in the flow.  We would be adding a new step here for users to do, right?
So probably creating a new custom TEC branded page to allow users to anonymously link their BrightID to a eth address they use for praise/SC in TEC.
there is this step
to activate for both
Yes, and I think I'm learning now that we want the BrightID step to come later so as not to interfere with data gathering--but not so late as to discourage voting.
yeah, if this was included in the this initial activation I think it would be perfect
Ok I think I understand you.  So add an optional BrightID linking step here to the activation page?
wouldn't it be possible for this to happen at the activation phase, but not to interfere in the data gathering?
yeah!
And you can only receive the TEC tokens if you've linked your BrightID
correct - but you can still receive praise and grain nonetheless
yes, and we could actually use the BrightID discord bot if we want, because you already have a mapping of eth address to discord id right?
yes
If you don't have that mapping, then we can add a step to the registration page, otherwise we can let the use the discord bot.  Either way is actually pretty simple to do.
well, I think the praise bot and pollen bot do that mapping - correct me if i'm wrong @kristofer @Vyvy-vi

Ok, then let's make the decision based on which is a better user flow.  You're welcome to try out BrightID discord bot  https://github.com/ShenaniganDApp/brightid-discord-bot to see that flow. You can get an idea of how the "linking" on a web page flow looks here https://idchain.one/begin  .  The first option would need a mapping of discord ids to eth addresses, the second one collects eth addresses on the page.
The first option "just works" with no additional help from the BrightID integration team.  For the second option, we'd need to register TEC as an "app" in BrightID, but we're happy to do that.
thanks so much for your help Adam! our working group has a sync tomorrow so we can discuss all this and find the best approach
Is it one of the events listed in this server?  Maybe I can come.

I think we could maybe integrate both the bots
However, there's a lot of concerns that may pop up with doing this

About integrating BrightID with the onboarding bot...
I think that process can definitely add value, however I don't think it should be a "barrier to server entry" (BrightID verification for new users can take a while, and making people wait would be bad), but rather a "second stage of verification(ideally one integrated into our deployment of 1hive's pollen-bot)"
We should maybe discuss more about this (esp. with some input from communitas) 🤔

Isn’t that the same(?
I'm wondering how critical is this, considering that we haven't really started working on the reputation tokens? Moreover, I believe praise by design is sybil resistant?
Doesn’t seem like praise on its own is prone to Sybil attacks but if you add the reputation tokens there…
That’s something I’m wondering though, I get requiring BrightID for the rep token but why for TEC distributions?

Though isn't getting the rep token == you got a reasonable amount of praise == you created significant value == it can't be a sybil attack, unless they're acting in good faith for a while and then gaming the system

the idea is that the rep tokens are equivalent to the rewards score people receive in every round. This rep token would give them access to governance on snapshot that can return to being quadratic. Having the rep token allow people to move their TEC tokens to a private wallet if they want and still be able to vote. Bright ID verification ensures that the wallets with rep tokens are connected to a single identity
because the rep tokens should be minted with the info of the distribution
Q) Would that mean that we're separating TEC tokens from snapshot and only using it for gardens voting?
yep
CV is a little more resistant to plutocracy than snapshot
and we would still be managing funds on snapshot - like the the lasertag decisions for example
so it's important to have boundaries + be quadratic
Though, shouldn't this discussion(about snapshot) been had during the params configuration? (IMHO, it might cause some of the hatchers or supporters to feel like the terms have changed)

I get that’s an easier way to deal with the process but I dont think that answers my concerns, does that decision justify possibly excluding users from the rewards that may not want to go through the BrightID verification?
That’s an ongoing discussion on communitas right now as well for the onboarding process, anonymity is highly appreciated by many on the space

Almost like saying - "We don't do Conviction Voting for proposals that TEC makes for smaller internal decisions, and only people directly earning rewards from the reward system get to vote on those things..."
Also, is there a distinction between what can and what can't be a Snapshot vote?
they can still activate brightid with their anon account
yeah
there is also the polycentric gov post on the forum explaining in more details
we haven't had any pushback so far in the working group advice process here -- but since you're raising this concern we can upgrade to a large advice process
hatcher's wouldn't be affected tho, we would still maintain their score from the hatch period

the only difference would be for new members. up until the hatch we had a process to know people were value aligned, but once the market opened that became harder to filter. So the rep would be a proof of alignment based on contributions
I think we should have a forum post about this @Vyvy-vi you're right. We were just investigating if it was even possible at first
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bvpgt8YbDJxdrC3i3cEK9HJYwPwrqNiaUV8nFDyDPgc/edit#

Hi everyone! The new praise bot will be a two part command. To interact with the praise bot you will type `/praise`. Then you add another command to send/give/dish the actual praise. 

Historically, we have been talking about "dishing" praise. It has a nice ring to it but for non english native speakers such as me, it is a bit unclear what "dish" actually means.

"Sending" praise is clear and unambiguous but perhaps a bit.. formal?

"Giving" praise. Also clear but less formal. I give you my praise. 

What will it be? Let's do a poll:

1️⃣  `/praise dish`

2️⃣ `/praise send`

3️⃣ `/praise give`

Another thing that can help, in cases where quantifiers got certain habits, like range of quants, and values of certain praises, is to use some clustering. messages.content:
Some thoughts on possible options to consider:

1️⃣ This pace of quant work catch-up is for a limited time, can it be spread out a bit more?
2️⃣ What are the benefits of the praise culture and activity? I get this generically, mostly, but what is true in this specific instance? Visible benefits night help bring more folk into the activity. Folk do get the point about reputation, but maybe less so that it is typically evaluated and awarded by others, not ourselves. Does no praise equal no reputation? How are praise givers rewarded?
3️⃣ Persuading other DAOs to take this path might require some adaptation. A limitation or set descriptions on the praise that can be offered might help other DAOs adopt the system.

Hello @Lewwwk, @Cesar, @Lin, @Jori Ethichub, @Media, seems like your DMs are closed. I am sending you this message on behalf of the #💸｜reward-system WG: we are going to send out the TEC tokens that you have earned through praise. In order to be able to receive it, you need to connect your Discord handle with your Ethereum address. 

This can be done by activating your account on our Discord server. 
**1. Go to TEC Praise channel #🙏｜praise

I implemented a strike system for quantifier attendance, I have been keeping track of quantifiers who have not quantified or partially quantified and I believe we should set some process for repercussions. It's important to keep an active quantifier pool so that we can have reliable and complete quants.

System is as follows:
total no show = 1
not quantified but notified an admin = 0.5
partial completion (>5% and <95% completion) = 0.5
2 strikes = removal from pool with notice
full quantification removes 1 strike
If you didn't quantify then the strike carries forward

messages.content: Was thinking about the praise system today and I wondered what if every time someone does a praise they get prompted to do a quant? This way everyone gets to quant but it’s not a high energy burden and it’s an alternative to trying to attract people to a quant role. It could be good if everyone got involved and were knowledgeable about both sides of the rewards system as a TEC member (praise and quant side). Has this been suggested before? Does it seem feasible?

It is an interesting idea, thanks! Currently we don't want everyone to be a quantifier. Everyone as in for example really new community members. Before quantifying you should have some basic knowledge about the community and have been onboarded as a quantifier. We also want to identify duplicates - that is why one quantifier gets to quantify all praise for one receiver/period. Quantifying individual Praise separately would make duplicate identification harder. But I love the idea of all praise being quantified always, that the process of quantifying is fully decentralised and constantly ongoing.

What makes a duplicate? Is it someone praising the same praise twice, or multiple people praising the same act or person?

- same praise giver, same praise verbatim and the same week = dismiss
- same praise giver, same/similar praise verbatim and different weeks = quantify
- different praise giver, same contribution praised and the same week = duplicate
- different praise giver, same contribution praised and different week = quantify

Hey 👋, I have a question that I would love to discuss. So our reward system has been developing fastly in last couple of months with quantification periods, bot developments and more ! However, even though we have improved the system a lot, the reward system requires lots of manual labor. I am wondering how is the discussions regarding automization of that process going on ? ( I am not regular in wg so sorry if these are already being discussed) I believe our reward system may benefit a lot from Natural language processing models in making automized quantification. We have lots of quantifiers that can make labeling job to feed AI. What do you guys think ? @divine_comedian  @kristofer @ygg_anderson
I think I opened a Pr some time ago to remove those terms 🤔
We discussed this a while ago, while it's cool it takes away the human element that is very crucial. Providing decentralized updates, creating ways for community engagement with quantifying roles..

Yes @Mert Ozd, we believe the praise items being quantified by humans being super important.
- The praise feed provides a rich source of information about what goes on in the community. Quantifiers effectively get paid to learn more about the community. Knowing and appreciating what your peers do is an effective way to build community.
- No current AI would be able to asses the importance of a contribution based on the words in the praise items alone. Added context is often needed - having read other praise, having read a forum post referring to the contribution in question etc.

embeds.description: Hi, my name's Pollen Bot, I handle some Pollen related actions. All my commands are prefixed by `!sc`. Refer to the list below for a list of my commands!

fields.name: !sc info
fields.value: Displays information of what Pollen is and how to get started.

fields.name: !sc mycred
fields.value: Shows your total cred, cred earned last week and cred earned this week.

fields.name: !sc userinfo
fields.value: Shows your pollen user info saved in the database.

fields.name: !sc save-wallet YourWalletAddress
fields.value: Saves your wallet address, Discord ID and Discord tag in the database (address will be used for pollen payouts).

fields.name: !sc verify-discourse YourDiscourseUsername
fields.value: Begins the process of verifying and saving your Discourse username in the database.

fields.name: !sc verify-github YourGithubUsername
fields.value: Begins the process of verifying and saving your GitHub username in the database.

fields.name: !sc update-discord
fields.value: Updates your Discord ID and tag in the database.

hey there rewards, I've some analysis on correlation between praise + usdc moneys, I wanted to see whether and by how much praise is actually captivating further value streams than the pecuniary payouts (usdc,xdai) the TEC has
would be cool to get another analyst to go over the process, yet what I have come to is that Praise highly correlates with pecuniary benefits at the TEC

though this may be unwelcome news, for the value streams we are tapping into with Praise are highly correlated, what it should mean is that a higher dependence on Praise over WG moneys for usual affairs should lead to very similar results
https://github.com/m-r-g-t/tec-data-analysis/blob/main/reward_vs_payouts/
the analysis is not discriminating over payout rounds, but instead looking at the aggregate
(note - axis are weird at the moment because they're log(x),log(y)
what happens when no log is applied?
the pattern can't be drawn out as easily but I can draw it, too
as with every organisation, payouts follow a chi-squared pattern
@Nuggan did you ever get the time to review @kristofer 's pr for finding missed praise recipients? You were still planning on writing the scripts, yes?

I think that's a pretty fair conclusion, we've slowed down on wg payments, it's been a struggle for many wg's to pass funding proposals so I think praise has been the easiest and most consistent way we've been distributing retroactive funding for people who have been creating value
whether people choose for the governance or hodling TEC vs. cashing out is probably a result of many contributors not getting paid by other means for the work they do.
there is an open PR on github which includes the result of combining the diffs from the last 16 rounds. It hasn't been merged yet, though. Maybe smth to discuss tomorrow in the call

because of low number of datapoints, and backpayments as the norm, I can probably only make two or three time periods without deep-cleaning the dune data
a new one we'd merge into kristofers branch before we merge into main

messages.content:
I think some overall trends is that people are tending to underscore - even for high impact contributions like development work or giving talks at conferences

Also the amount of praise given over a period was reaching some historic lows - maybe there isn't happening or people just aren't praising
also I'm very curious about @r-x-x work on correlating people who are getting paid by WGs also getting the highest amount of praise rewards

on the first one, my personal experience is that it's just hard to determine high value, we've had certain discussions on things that should be given low scores (i.e. attending meetings) but nothing that acts as a point of reference for stuff that should be given max - and if most praises are to be compared against the low score reference i would expect people to tend to quantify on a certain range

on the amount of praise, i chatted about this with a few members, we have new contributors that aren't fully integrated into the whole community and are yet to receive proper education on praise and idk if there's anything to be made to help them develop the habit
A super high score isn't obligatory but I see often stuff like someone physically presents at a conference or codes a front-end and someone gives them a score of 3
yeah that seems unfair
that's a lot of work or seems obviously high impact or a specialized in demand skill
would it be possible that some of that is because some of the quantifiers aren't that much around anymore? like maybe we want to onboard some fresh contributors?
nvm i just saw the last few quants and at least half on each round are usuals
sure I mean a few of us could speculate on whatever but I think its far more useful to broaden the discussion and see what conclusions the group can make
or maybe any gaps we have in education that could be filled
what I really want is some people who are still on the reward board or new contributors to show up and help me make praise better
Yes actually. Sorry I've been absent there. I started a thread with @r-x-x today in the latest doc he's putting together
happy to provide the comparative data regarding praise and working group spending if it helps this
I would love to have you collab with Livi and prepare some sort of analysis
maybe it's a forum post or even a less formal discussion in discord
